wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Drummond Downes (23 February 1883, in Kelvinside, Glasgow – 12 September 1956, in Helensburgh) was a Scottish sailor who competed for the Royal Clyde Yacht Club at the 1908 Summer Olympics.He was a crew member of the Scottish boat Hera, which won the gold medal in the 12 metre class.

response: * Arthur Downes (18831956), Scottish sailor who competed at the 1908 Summer Olympics
* Arthur Downes (police officer) (18951984), British-born New Zealand soldier, clerk, salesman and policeman
